Description: Upper body sherd of North Ionian black-figured Wild Goat Style pottery oinochoe; exterior: dull cream slip; from top: frieze of incised pendant lotus flowers with petals in added red on wide black band; black-figure frieze decoration consisting of confronted swan and griffin (of swan, back and tail feathers are missing; red on neck, chest, and alternate feathers; of griffin, hind legs are missing; red on neck and alternate feathers); short vertical strokes, red pinwheel rosette; rosettes and crossed rosettes as filling ornament; below, black band with added red band lined in white; at bottom of sherd frieze, back and antler of goat, to left, preserved; pendant rosette and undetermined decoration as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.612)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (37, pl. 18, 32)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (58, pl. 6, 8)
